events.title: Battle of Puebla
events.description: Mexican forces under General Ignacio Zaragoza defeated the French army at the Battle of Puebla during the French intervention in Mexico.
events.significance: This victory is celebrated annually in Mexico as Cinco de Mayo, symbolizing Mexican resistance and unity.

events.title: Napoleon Bonaparte Dies
events.description: Napoleon Bonaparte, the former Emperor of France and a dominant military and political figure in Europe, died on the island of Saint Helena.
events.significance: His death marked the end of an era in European history, influencing political boundaries and ideologies.

events.title: First World's Fair in the United States Opens
events.description: The Louisiana Purchase Exposition, known as the 1904 St. Louis World's Fair, opened to showcase advances in technology and culture.
events.significance: The event had a major impact on American culture and showcased significant technological innovations.

events.title: Alan Shepard Becomes the First American in Space
events.description: Astronaut Alan Shepard completed the first American manned spaceflight aboard the Freedom 7 Mercury capsule.
events.significance: This milestone marked the United States' entry into human space exploration during the Space Race.
